lines.text: He's after me! He's after me! Don't let him kill me! Don't! Don't, I'm too young to die! Save me! Save me! Don't let him kill me! Hide me! Hide me!

[Slaps Daffy]
Okay, snap out of it. I'll hide you. Get under here.
[Puts Daffy under boulder]
Nope, not here.
[Stuffs Daffy into hollow tree]
Hide in here.
[Pulls Daffy out and kicks him up another tree]
No, no. Up there.
[Chops tree down]
No, no, no, down here.
[Tosses Daffy off cliff; he lands beak first into frozen lake]
Nope. No good. Better try up here.
[Tosses Daffy all over the place]
No, here. There. Here. There. Here. No, here. There. Here. There. Here. There. Here. There...
[iris out]
He's after me! He's gonna kill me! Don't let him kill me! I'm too young to die! I have my whole life before me! Love! Travel! Good books!
[sobbing]
Hide me! Hide me! Hide me!

[slaps Tom]
Here, pull yourself together, Tom. Snap out of it! Snap out of it! You're verging on the hysterical!
[Hits Tom until he's unconscious]
Come on now, brace up. Brace up. There, that's more like it. Let's see now. Where will I hide this seagull? Ooh, here we are.
[Puts Tom's head under a boulder]
No, no, a little too obvious. Yeah, too obvious.
[Shoves Tom into a hole and tamps him down with a stick]
No, even more obviouser.
You lose something, fat stuff?
I'm l-l-looking for a d-d-darned old t-turkey.
Sir! Do you mean to insinuate that I'd hide your d-d-arned old t-t-turkey?
I was ce-ce-certain it came this way.
Well, I ain't talkin', see? My lips are sealed.
[Locks appear on Daffy's beak]
Well, g-g-gee, uh, g-g-gee...
I ain't no stool pigeon, see.

[Inside snowman]
What a pal, what a pal, what a pal, what a pal, what a pal. What a pal.
Oh, d-d-dagnabit. And I had everything r-ready for a nice, big t-t-turkey dinner.
Not a word out of me! I ain't no squealer. I'm no... Turkey dinner?
Uh-huh. And with ch-ch-chestnut dressing too.
Mmm-mmm. No. No, I won't talk. They can't make me. I'm no stool pigeon. I'm not... Cranberry sauce?
Yeah, and w-with mashed potatoes and green peas.
Mashed potatoes and green peas? Gulp. No. No, they can't sweat it out of me. I won't be a stool pigeon! I won't! I won't be a st... And... and candied yams?
Uh-huh. C-Candied yams.

[Sobbing]
The yams did it! The yams did it! The yams did it!
[Stands on a stool marked "stool pigeon", cooing like a pigeon; rushes the snowman with Tom inside in front of Porky and puts up hundreds of signs pointing to it]
I didn't wanna do it. It was those yams. Oh, those nasty yams!
Quisling.
C-c-come out of there. I've got you covered. C-come one out of there, you old turkye you. Come out or I'll b-blast you!
[Tom digs his way out and sneaks up behind Daffy]
Those nasty, delicious yams!

[Puts his tail on Daffy before sneaking away]
Gobble, gobble, gobble.
So t-there you are, you old turkey.
Turkey? Who's a turkey? Now wait a minute, Myles Standish. I'm a duck. Quack, quack, quack! I can swim. Observe.
[Dives into snow and swims, then runs as Porky gives chase]
